Time is ripe for Russian conquest of the central and eastern Ukraine. There are a confluence of geopolitical circumstances that suggest Putin will take action before mid-September 2016. President Obama¡¯s term is ending and President Putin also has critical Russian parliamentary elections on September 18, 2016. Putin has had to enact draconic anti-protest laws in the face of a high inflation rate, declining consumer demand, and expanding poverty among the middle class. A quick victory in the Ukraine should enhance his party¡¯s prestige before the election. Additionally, the strategic level Russian military exercises in the Western Military District are scheduled to begin 12 days before the parliamentary election on September 6, 2016. These exercises will provide cover for vast numbers of units and troops to converge on the exercise area near the Ukraine. The long range weather forecast is for perfectly sunny skies from August 23 to 6 September, 2016. Furthermore, President Putin recently fired his Defense Minister Sergei Ivanov, who had been the Kremlin Chief of Staff and knew many high ranking officers in the Defense establishment. This firing of the Defense Minister could be considered an anti-coup preventative measure if Putin is indeed intending to go to war with men, material and live ammunition converging from all over Russia toward the Ukraine. I would suspect the optimum invasion window would be August 23, 2016 to September 6, 2016 taking advantage of the excellent weather, the exercise as cover to move troop and material, and allowing time for victory before the parliamentary elections.
